title: Lost Monastery Adventure #11
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Meditation Chamber
rooms.description: A serene stone chamber with faded tapestries hanging on the walls. Incense burners sit cold and unused. Shafts of dusty light filter through high windows. The air is still and heavy with centuries of silence. Prayer cushions are arranged in a circle around a central altar.

items.name: stone altar
items.description: A simple altar with carved symbols and a small offering bowl

items.name: small copper key
items.description: An aged copper key with monastery symbols etched into it

items.name: wooden prayer cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three drawers used for storing sacred texts and items

items.name: monastery chronicle
items.description: An ancient book recording the monastery's history
items.text: The Monastery of Silent Peaks was founded in the year 1108 by Master Chen. Our three sacred principles guide all who dwell here: Wisdom, Compassion, and Discipline. May these teachings endure through the ages.

items.name: heavy iron key
items.description: A large iron key that looks important

items.name: circle of prayer cushions
items.description: Worn cushions arranged for meditation practice

items.name: hidden scroll
items.description: A scroll tucked beneath one of the cushions
items.text: Brother Wei's reminder: Master Chen taught that true knowledge resides in the Sacred Library. The three principles unlock all doors. Remember: the first principle illuminates the mind, the second opens the heart, the third strengthens the spirit.

items.name: ornate wooden chest
items.description: A beautifully carved chest with a copper lock

items.name: letter from Master Chen
items.description: A personal letter sealed with the master's seal
items.text: To my devoted students: I have hidden the path to enlightenment in the Sacred Library. Only those who understand our three principles may enter. The Inner Sanctum awaits those pure of heart. - Master Chen

items.name: heavy wooden door
items.description: A thick door leading deeper into the monastery. It requires the iron key.

rooms.name: Sacred Library
rooms.description: A vast library with towering shelves filled with ancient texts and scrolls. Dust motes dance in beams of light from narrow windows. The smell of old paper and sandalwood fills the air. Stone tablets with inscriptions line the walls. A magnificent door carved with symbols stands at the far end.

items.name: wisdom bookshelf
items.description: A shelf dedicated to texts about wisdom and knowledge
items.text: Shelf label: 'Wisdom - The First Principle. Through wisdom, we illuminate the darkness of ignorance.'

items.name: compassion bookshelf
items.description: A shelf containing teachings on compassion and kindness
items.text: Shelf label: 'Compassion - The Second Principle. Through compassion, we open our hearts to all beings.'

items.name: discipline bookshelf
items.description: A shelf holding texts about discipline and practice
items.text: Shelf label: 'Discipline - The Third Principle. Through discipline, we strengthen our spirit and resolve.'

items.name: reading table
items.description: A large table with several open books and scrolls

items.name: librarian's note
items.description: A note left by the monastery librarian
items.text: The Inner Sanctum can only be accessed by those who know the sacred principles and honor our founder. Brother Wei keeps forgetting - I've told him a hundred times that Master Chen's teachings are the key to everything!

items.name: inscribed stone tablets
items.description: Ancient tablets with monastery teachings carved into them
items.text: Tablet inscription: 'Let all who seek enlightenment remember the three pillars upon which this monastery stands. Let all who enter the Inner Sanctum speak the name of our founder with reverence.'

items.name: carved sanctum door
items.description: An ornate door carved with images of monks in meditation. Three questions are inscribed on a bronze plaque beside it.

password_questions.question: What is the first sacred principle?
password_questions.hint: Check the monastery chronicle and the bookshelves in the library

password_questions.question: What is the second sacred principle?
password_questions.hint: The three principles are mentioned in multiple texts throughout the monastery

password_questions.question: Who founded this monastery?
password_questions.hint: The monastery chronicle records the founder's name

rooms.name: Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You have reached the Inner Sanctum! A peaceful chamber bathed in golden light from a circular skylight above. In the center sits a meditation platform surrounded by lotus flowers. The walls are adorned with beautiful murals depicting the monastery's history. A hidden passage behind a tapestry leads to freedom - the mountain path outside.

items.name: golden meditation platform
items.description: A raised platform where the masters achieved enlightenment

items.name: sacred lotus flowers
items.description: Fresh lotus flowers that somehow still bloom in this ancient place

items.name: historical murals
items.description: Beautiful paintings showing the monastery's founding and golden age
items.text: The murals depict Master Chen founding the monastery, monks studying in the library, and generations of students achieving enlightenment in this very sanctum.

rooms.win_message: You have reached the Inner Sanctum and discovered the path to freedom! As you stand in this sacred space, you feel a sense of peace and accomplishment. The hidden passage behind the tapestry leads you safely down the mountain. You have solved the mysteries of the Lost Monastery and escaped. You win!
